reviewText: My favorite comedian of ALL time.  I love stand up comedy.  Been a fan since I was 7 and watching Eddie Murphy's RAW.  Ever since then, I loved watching stand up.  In all that time, I have to say that there have been only one comedian that has made me laugh so hard that I had to stand up and hunch over: Lavelle Crawford.  Time and time again, this funny man has done it to me.  I don't know what it is, but he is just the best.
Title: Lavell Crawford: Can a Brother Get Some Love?

reviewText: I bought this because I saw Lavelle Crawford on another stand up comedy and he was funny. I enjoyed this one as well.

reviewText: I just wish that he would not cuss so much. It is hard to find clean comedy these days, or I am looking in the wrong places. I do like Lavell though, I do think that he is funny, minus the cussing. I have heard much worst from other comedians, but still I just don't think that he has to cuss to be funny. He's just rare. Funny, without the cussing.

reviewText: I understand that comedy is subjective. Along with music, it is one of the harder categories of entertainment to judge because, oftentimes, it just comes down to a matter of taste. But comedy DVDs have an additional stigma that other DVD choices don't face. They have less replay value. If you are a fan of a particular comedian and you follow them, you have to expect that you will hear some material that they've used successfully in the past. The most common complaint I see leveled at comedy DVDs are that the jokes aren't fresh. That's right, folks--every time a comedian steps up to the stage, his entire act isn't going to be newly devised and original. And if you were going to tape a show for the general public to buy, wouldn't you use jokes and material that have proven popular and successful? I would!That said, I'm a fan of Lavell Crawford. I knew what to expect going in--and while I think the man is generally hilarious, this concert was wildly uneven for my taste. I am undoubtedly in the minority--his St. Louis audience embraced the act wholeheartedly. Crawford is undeniably successful when spinning a yarn about his family or upbringing. When he talks about his mother and a simple trip to the grocery store, the routine soared with its simplicity and Crawford's spot-on impersonation. Other targets were a bit too expected. The mere mention of homosexuality is the ultimate punchline that recurs through the concert piece which seems somewhat unimaginative in this day and age. I don't ask for political correctness, I just look for something more creative from Crawford's humor. I had seem some of the routine in other incarnations--but it all fits together nicely here. A solid showcase for Crawford if not the best I've seen of him. About 3 1/2 stars. KGHarris, 8/11.
summary: Big Humor From A Big Man: An Uneven, But Funny, Night With Lavell Crawford
Title: Lavell Crawford: Can a Brother Get Some Love?

reviewText: I watched this DVD, in preparation for surgery and recovery. Mr. Crawford literally had me in stitches. In addition to talking about his own life, he has words of wisdom to help us get through life. Thank you, Mr. Crawford for helping me get through this difficult time. I can't wait for your next DVD.

reviewText: Prior to me watching this, I've only heard this man on the radio, mainly on "The Steve Harvey Morning Show" and I always found him to be hilarious! I made up my mind one day that I was gonna get this DVD, and I am so glad I did, it was worth every penny. You may have already heard about this, but one of my favorite parts of this show was when he talks about when he was a child and he and mother and siblings went to the grocery store. She would always give a speech, you will just have to check it out cause this dude is funny!!
Title: Lavell Crawford: Can a Brother Get Some Love?

reviewText: I remember seeing him on Last Comic Standing & he was hilarious.I heard about  this through a commercial for another comedy DVD i was watching. i was happy to see that he had his own stand-up special, so i had to get it.Just in the first 10 minutes, i was DONE! The laughter you'll experience after watching this -- you might not be able to breathe.Definitely a must-have, if you're having a bad day & need a good hearty laugh. also good to own for comedy fans! :)
summary: i don't think i've laughed harder in my life ...
Title: Lavell Crawford: Can a Brother Get Some Love?

reviewText: I enjoyed this so much! LC is extremely talented, naturally witty, and made me laugh so hard it hurt. My fave parts were his jokes about his mother and his "Super Obama" bit. (Omg... hysterical!) One small criticism: He has a tendency to mumble every so often which made me have to rewind parts a couple times so I heard the full jokes. It didn't happen so frequently that I couldn't keep watching (obviously,) but I hope he gets over that for future shows. Otherwise, you won't regret watching this. EXTREMELY funny and the best new comic I've found in years!!
Title: Lavell Crawford: Can a Brother Get Some Love?

reviewText: this comedy was super funny. if you are in the mood for some good jokes and a few laughs, you have to get this dvd. lavell crawford had me rolling on the floor crying. i can watch this over and over. a must get.
summary: can a brother get some love?
